intro: Hieracium seilandicum, commonly known as the Seiland hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium seilandicum is often found in calcareous soils and can form dense colonies in suitable environments.
